meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 1/16 of a pound or 28.35 grams.
meanings.sent1: She measured the flour for the recipe using an ounce.
meanings.sent2: He bought half an ounce of gold for his collection.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse carried an ounce of cheese back to its hole.
meanings.sent4: Her smile weighed an ounce of pure joy.
meanings.sent5: The ounce of perfume in the room filled the air with a sweet scent.

meanings.sent1: He only had an ounce of patience left after waiting for hours.
meanings.sent2: She added an ounce of sugar to the tea to sweeten it.
meanings.sent3: The ounce of courage he mustered up helped him speak in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her words carried an ounce of truth that resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The ounce of kindness she showed made a big difference in his day.
